dialogues.text: Killick is with NAGEL and others tarring the ratlines as looks back at HOLLOM, patrolling the gangway. KILLICK indicates him with a tilt of the head. KILLICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That engagement off Recife: his whole gun crew killed and him not a mark on him. Soon as he went up the mizzen mast Warley falls. And whose watch was it when we lost our wind? HOLLOM sees them looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: THE SCUTTLEBUTT, SHIP'S WAIST
dialogues.text: A marine sentry, TROLLOPE, stands guard by the ship's wat barrel - the level is very low. STEPHEN ladles some water into a phial. TROLLOPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One glass per man, sir, Captain's orders. STEPHEN straightening, irritated by the challenge. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mere thimbleful, Corporal, for scientific purposes only.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN'S CABIN
dialogues.text: In the gloom of his cabin, STEPHEN angles the mirror of h brass microscope toward the window, and places a slide containing a droplet of water under the lens.

dialogues.speaker: MAINMAST-TOP
dialogues.text: JACK climbs into the top. He adjusts his telescope, studi the horizon. 173.   JACK'S TELESCOPE P.O.V. He pans across the empty sea. 174.   STEPHEN'S MICROSCOPE P.O.V. An assortment of mobile, transparent micro-organisms rota wildly. STEPHEN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, Padeen, a veritable zoo. PADEEN takes a look, amazed then greatly amused.

dialogues.speaker: THE GREAT CABIN
dialogues.text: Charts are spread all over the table, STEPHEN poring over them when Jack comes in [   ] STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me where these Doldrums lie? JACK joins him. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen. Will we never make a sailor of you? The doldrums is a condition, not a region. But you tend to strike 'em here... (pointing) ...between the trades, and the sou'easterlies. I hope the Acheron is having it as bad as we are. STEPHEN considers their current position on the chart, th tiny Galapagos Islands to the north and the vast emptines the west of them. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assuming he is heading for the Galapagos, and not some other point in all this vastness? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come. I'd have thought you'd be delighted to go there. It is said to be a natural paradise STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In truth I'd be delighted with the merest guano stained rock provided it didn't sway beneath my feet JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we'll take on food and water once we're there, and as compensation for not having put ashore in Brazil I pledge that during that time, several days at least, you can wander at will, catching bugs and beetles to your heart's delight. You will be the first naturalist to set foot on the islands. That is my solemn promise STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I accept, provided the men have not mutinied and thrown us all overboard before we get there. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mutiny? No. They are already counting their share of the prize money. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another week of this and they shall gladly give it up for a glass of clean water. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ach, Stephen. Stephen. Pray stop your bellyacheing. We shall have rain presently, and if not we shall damned well tow ourselves out of this.

dialogues.speaker: JOLLY BOAT
dialogues.text: Disgruntled, under-slept men, in boats towing the ship. NAGEL and DAVIES look back darkly at HOLLOM who sits in t stern. HOLLOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stroke. Stroke... DAVIES (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard he were on the Fair Marion as foundered off Tresco. And he were on the Zephyrus what exploded at Trafalgar. HOLLOM has heard this, as DAVIES intended, but he looks a choosing to ignore them.

dialogues.speaker: FIGHTING TOP
dialogues.text: A view from above of men towing the ship. Over this an unpleasant scraping sound - chalk on slate. BONDEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M-a-s-t... mast STEPHEN is writing words on a slate then offering them to BONDEN whom he is teaching to read. BONDEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S-u-n... sun STEPHEN nods and scratches another word on the board. As BONDEN struggles to decipher it there's the sound of a mu shot and a seabird falls out of the sky. HOWARD, the captain of marines, reloads his smoking muske laughing aloud. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that man completely mad? (shouts down) Mr. Howard, a petrel is not good eating! HOWARD looks up towards them, a broad smile on his red mo of a face. HOWARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you never a man for sporting, Doctor? Why you could shoot all day in these waters with two men loading!

dialogues.speaker: GUN-DECK
dialogues.text: The midshipmen and powder-monkeys have assembled for weap practise, armed with cutlasses. CALAMY and WILLIAMSON div the group into two teams, choosing sides as for school-ya football. CALAMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blakeney... WILLIAMSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rye... CALAMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swift... WILLIAMSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyle... CALAMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the final choice) All right, come on Addison. Little ADDISON joins CALAMY's side, trailing his too-larg sword. WILLIAMSON tosses a coin. CALAMY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heads. WILLIAMSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's tails. We attack. CALAMY's side retire to a defensive position made of tar barrels at one end of the deck. From here they are sudden aware of Jack idly watching their mock-fight from the quarter-deck WILLIAMSON's team give a yell and charge at them. It's serious fighting. Heads are struck, fingers are rapp BLAKENEY, trying gamely with his left arm but frustrated his own ineptitude, goes down under the rush of attackers BLAKENEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow ow ow! WILLIAMSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yield. CALAMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of him. WILLIAMSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yield!! CALAMY can't drag the bigger boy off. He whips a pistol o of his belt and fires it at WILLIAMSON's head. WILLIAMSON is blasted sideways, clutching his face and yelling in pain. The other boys separate, horrified. CALAMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just powder. There wasn't a ball in it, just powder. He helps BLAKENEY to his feet. CALAMY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right? BLAKENEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Angrily shaking free of him, he looks to where Jack stood but the captain is no longer watching. CALAMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? I saved you. BLAKENEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't need to be saved.

dialogues.speaker: ON DECK
dialogues.text: Tar bubbling under the heat of the sun. Cannons fizzing a steaming as they are washed. There's been a change of crews in the long-boats, and HOL and his men are now back on board. NAGEL is approaching f one end of the narrow gang-way, HOLLOM from the other. NA pushes past, deliberately bumping HOLLOM, who stumbles, clutching for the gunwale.

dialogues.speaker: QUARTERDECK
dialogues.text: JACK sees this outrageous act of indiscipline and yells o JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master at arms! Take that man below and clap him in irons. Mr. Pullings, defaulters at six bells.

dialogues.speaker: THE GREAT CABIN, DOLDRUMS
dialogues.text: JACK stands behind his desk, brow like thunder. From outs the sounds of the muster. HOLLOM stands in front of him, twisting his hat between his hands. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man pushed past you without making his obedience. And yet you said nothing. HOLLOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Sir, I intended to but the right words just didn't... JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'The right words'? He failed to salute you. It's deliberate insubordination. HOLLOM looks at the floor, mumbles - HOLLOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't like me, Sir. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They what? Speak up, man! HOLLOM raises his head and looks at JACK, his eyes shiny tears and when he opens his mouth the words tumble out in rush. HOLLOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've tried to get to know the men a bit, Sir, be friendly like, but they've taken a set against me. Always whispering when I go past, giving me looks. But, I'll set that to rights, be tougher on them from now on. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't make 'friends' with the foremast jacks, they'll despise you in the end. Nor do you need be a tyrant. It's leadership they want, strength, respect. HOLLOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very sorry, Sir. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're what twenty-three, twenty-four? HOLLOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling weakly) Twenty-five next Friday. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've failed to pass for lieutenant twice. You can't spend the rest of your life as a midshipman. HOLLOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try harder, Sir. KILLICK helps JACK on with his full-dress uniform. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's an unfortunate business, Hollom. Damned unfortunate. KILLICK seems to endorse this by placing the captain's ha emphatically on JACK's head. Jack turns and strides out of the cabin, HOLLOM following slowly after him.

dialogues.speaker: QUARTERDECK, DOLDRUMS
dialogues.text: The entire crew has been mustered. The uniformed officers line the quarterdeck as JACK reads from the Articles of W JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Article Thirty-Six. All other crimes not capital, committed by any person or persons in the fleet... shall be punished according to the laws, and customs, of the sea.' (then, to NAGEL) Mr. Nagel, you're an old man-of-war's man and yet you failed to salute an officer. You knew what you were doing. Have you anything to say in your defence? NAGEL looks at the deck. NAGEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Sir. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have his officers anything to say for him? DAVIES and KILLICK scowl across the deck at HOLLOM, who l wretched but says nothing. JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seize him up. NAGEL is spread-eagled to the grating, his hands tied. HOLLAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seized up, Sir. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One dozen. Bosun's mate, do your duty. The mate takes the leather cat-o-nine tails out of its re bag.

dialogues.speaker: THE GREAT CABIN
dialogues.text: JACK stands alone, tuning his fiddle. No matter how much turns the peg the top string always sounds flat. He tunes some more and breaks it. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red hell...

dialogues.speaker: QUARTERDECK
dialogues.text: JACK (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and bloody death! Every word is plainly audible to the men on watch, who pretend to hear nothing.

dialogues.speaker: THE GREAT CABIN
dialogues.text: JACK is fitting a new string. Widen to reveal STEPHEN sit opposite with his cello. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was merely remarking that you have always prided yourself on not being a flogging captain and this... JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not a "flogging captain". I have not once rigged the grating on this voyage, not once in twelve thousand miles. Besides, I wager you will find a deal more brutality on land. Tightening the new string. The note escalating as he turn STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a party to it on land. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you are party to it on my ship. Men must be governed. Often not wisely I grant you, but there are hierarchies even in nature, as you've often said yourself. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hierarchies. That is the excuse of every tyrant in history. Of Nero. Of Boneparte. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to call a halt) Yes. Fine words I'm sure STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continues regardless) ...We are not animals and I for one am opposed to authority, that egg of misery and oppression.. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very fine words Stephen, but In these current circumstances, hard-work and firm discipline is what keeps our little wooden world together. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And grog I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. What of it? Of course they have their grog! STEPHEN (sits) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Nagel was drunk when he insulted Hollom. And Higgins is never sober. Even the midshipmen... JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men will have their grog Stephen. It is part of the immemorial tradition of the service STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well a shameful tradition it is too. To have them pressed from their homes, kept in a permanent state of dull inebriation. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen... STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...confined for months in a wooden prison, Never more than a few hours sleep and flogged when drunken idleness drives them to.... JACK (forcefully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Stephen! I warn you that friend or no I will not have you talk of the service like that. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am stating plain facts JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally explodes) Well I will not hear them! From you or anyone. You understand! Things are as they are for good or bad whether or not they have a place in your damned papist philosophy. If you are here to make music then sit down and play. If not be gone, for you have come to the wrong shop for anarchy! In stony silence Stephen puts down his cello bow and leav past Killick, who is lurking as always by the door.

dialogues.speaker: SCUTTLEBUTT
dialogues.text: Something disturbs the dark surface of the water as HOLLO dips the ladle and fills his cup. A sense of someone moving up behind him. HOLLOM turns abruptly. It's the marine sentry, moving in the shadows. stares at HOLLOM as he backs away toward the ladder and hurries below.

dialogues.speaker: BERTH DECK
dialogues.text: To reach his quarters he is obliged to walk the length of berth deck, past HOWARD obsessively cleaning his pistol, another man whittling with a knife, DAVIES adding another link in the tattooed chain about BECKETT's middle. No-one speaks as HOLLOM runs the gauntlet of their stares acutely aware of his own breathing. It now seems universa to be held that he is the author of all the ship's misfortune. Nagle pointedly turns his back, the scars from the floggi gleaming wetly in the lamplight Hollom's breath quickens. He stumbles on someone's dunnag almost trips but is caught before he falls. It's one of NAGEL's mates. NAGEL's MATE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful, sir.

dialogues.speaker: MIDSHIPMAN'S BERTH
dialogues.text: HOLLOM comes in, wild-eyed and goes to his berth, breathi hard. CALAMY, BLAKENEY & BOYLE look up from a tense g cards. BLAKENEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right, Hollom? HOLLOM shakes his head miserably, hyperventilating. CALAMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not sick. He's useless. He's just dodging work. BLAKENEY (angrily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shut up Calamay. What do you know about anything? CALAMY glares at BLAKENEY.

dialogues.speaker: INT STEPHEN'S ROOM
dialogues.text: A shot from the deck above. STEPHEN looks up from his book "Di Consolazione Philosoph Then the sound of bare feet approaching, followed by a kn at the door. Its Joe Plaice, looking agitated. PLAICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beg your pardon, your honour, but Mr. Howard just shot a sea-monster!

dialogues.speaker: GANGWAY
dialogues.text: STEPHEN and PLAICE stride along to where the marine capta HOWARD, peers down into the water with one of his men. HOWARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor! The very man. STEPHEN moves to the rail, looks out. HOWARD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [   ] I wished you'd seen it for yourself, Doctor. The crew never seen anything like it. On the glassy sea, a smudge of blood and some ripples HOWARD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was prodigious like a human, though bigger, might have been a sea-elephant, it had a calf with it - I didn't mean to hit the calf, I missed my mark. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Howard, let me beg you, if the men can't eat it or I can't dissect it, please do not shoot every creature you see. STEPHEN stares back down at the ripples spreading over th glassy sea.

dialogues.speaker: THE SURPRISE
dialogues.text: Wide, on the troubled ship, small yellow patches of light visible from the gun-ports.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW DECKS
dialogues.text: The men are lying in their hammocks when, from somewhere outside, there comes an ungodly howling. It stops, then c again, exactly human in its pitch. The crew look at one another. This is like no sound they' ever heard. The howling stops then comes again, from another directio

dialogues.speaker: THE GREAT CABIN, EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: KILLICK and BLACK BILLY listening. KILLICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I tell you? The ship's accursed.

dialogues.speaker: QUARTERDECK
dialogues.text: JACK comes up from below. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that abominable noise, for God's sake? PULLINGS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea, Sir. MOWETT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think it's the Acheron, Sir? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (untypically cutting) The enemy cannot come on us without a wind, Mr. Mowett. He looks about at the terrified faces of the crew. The wailing sound now rises to a shriek, as STEPHEN joins the group. JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you make of it, Doctor? STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure I've never heard the like. The crew overhear this and pass it among themselves as another anguished howl fills the night. STEPHEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps it's the mother of the creature Mr. Howard shot. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [    ] Creature? STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [ ] A manatee. A sea-elephant possibly. Though I have never known one with a cry like this. A glance along at HOWARD on the gangway, as terrified as anyone. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bosun. Fire off some flares.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHIP
dialogues.text: Three flares soar and burst with a ghostly glow, making a pool of blue light around the ship, the sound continuing echo and re-echo from somewhere beyond.

dialogues.speaker: QUARTERDECK
dialogues.text: The light illuminates the half-hour glass, its top-half e of sand. Like everyone else, the duty sergeant stands fro to the spot. Jack rounds on him. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant, what the devil are you thinking of? Turn the glass and strike the bell. Roused, the duty sergeant turns the glass and time resume its flow. Two bells are hesitantly rung and the crew regain the pow of motion, their limbs still spastic with fear. And when sound comes once more they all freeze. JACK joins MOWETT at the taffrail. The thing is somewhere there, whatever it is. MOWETT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps some poor shipwreck? He shouts, a slight nervous catch to his voice. MOWETT (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahoy! Is anyone there? Part of him knows it's crazy and of course there's no rep The sound constantly shifting position, now in the water, in the sky. JACK turns to see a white face, frighteningly close to hi own. It's PADEEN, mouth agape, face unnaturally white, staring into the gloom as though drawn to whatever horror lies out there. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Padeen. What are you doing on the quarterdeck? He looks down at the press of men who have gathered at th bottom of the ladder, some with weapons. JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below! All of you men below! (to MOWETT) Tell the bosun those off-duty may sleep with their lamps on.

dialogues.speaker: LOWER DECK
dialogues.text: Several crewmen huddle close together their faces lit by battle-lantern. Joe Plaice grim. Doudle wide-eyed. Higgin with his alcoholic tremor more pronounced than ever. BLACK BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duppies make that noise. KILLICK (indicating BILL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See. They know all about this in Africa. DOUDLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a duppie? BLACK BILL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Warley. Swallow by a fish. Spirit can't get out. Him duppie now. SLADE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain don't even know what that noise be. General nods of agreement. DOUDLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor neither, and he knows everything. KILLICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe here's got the most experience in these matters, and new brains to boot, let's hear it from Joe. All eyes on JOE PLAICE. He speaks from the shadows. PLAICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the Jonah causing it. That howling thing is a signal to the Phantom-Ship. He's calling it up, don't you see? Every time he's on watch the ship appears. You wait and see, the ghost-ship will appear any time tonight, and take us all straight to the hot-place. Another shriek, closer now, seems to confirm JOE's bizarr theory.

dialogues.speaker: MIDSHIPMEN'S BERTH
dialogues.text: The boys sit together. None of them look at HOLLOM, who s pale and wretched in a corner of the room, clutching his stomach.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN'S CABIN
dialogues.text: As the howling continues, STEPHEN looks through a number books on sea-creatures searching for a reference to what they're experiencing. As JACK looks over his shoulder, his eye is caught by a picture in one of STEPHEN's books. He picks it up. Close on the picture - it's an engraving of a giant squid its tentacles wrapped around a ship. Back on JACK holding the picture up to STEPHEN. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think...? There is a knock on the cabin door and BLAKENEY enters, agitated. BLAKENEY (to STEPHEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Mr. Hollom, sir, you better come quick.

dialogues.speaker: MIDSHIPMEN'S BERTH
dialogues.text: HOLLOM writhing in agony on the floor, STEPHEN trying to him, shouting for assistance from the midshipmen and then from PADEEN. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Hollom. Sir. Try to contain yourself. Hold his head. Mr Hollom. Padeen 201.        STEPHEN'S CABIN - NIGHT. Stephen is writing some case notes in his journal, when J puts his head around the door. Stephens POV: The lamp, lighting his face from below and one side, gives a strange lopsided twist to Jacks smile JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well? STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing physically wrong with him. He thinks he's been cursed by the 0men. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he probably has been. Sailors will abide a great deal, but never a Jonah. It's like a white crow - the others peck it to death. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 'Jonah'? My God, you believe it too. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I desired to save you the trouble of looking for a cure. No doubt it will all be sorted by the morning.

dialogues.speaker: FORECASTLE, LATER
dialogues.text: BLAKENEY stands near the bows peering out into the night. figure approaches from behind and lays a hand in his shoulder. BLAKENEY nearly jumps out of his skin. BLAKENEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Hollom! You gave me such a start. Are you better now? HOLLOM's breathing does indeed seem easier. HOLLOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much better, thank you. BLAKENEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think the creature is going away. HOLLOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am sure of it. He reaches down, picks up a 12 pound cannonball. HOLLOM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've always been very kind to me. Goodbye, Blakeney. With a sudden movement he's on the gunwale, then he jumps over the side the cannonball in his arms. BLAKENEY looks down with shock to see HOLLOM's pale face receding from him into the depths. It's a moment before h gathers his wits to shout - BLAKENEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man overboard!

dialogues.speaker: QUARTERDECK
dialogues.text: The ship's company are mustered on deck. JACK stands at t sword rack lectern. KILLICK hands him a Bible open at the story of Jonah. JACK looks, then hands it back to KILLICK. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fact is, [   ] not all of us become the men we once hoped we might be. But we are all God's creatures. If some of us thought ill of Mr. Hollom, or spoke ill of him, or failed him in respect of fellowship, then we ask your forgiveness, Lord, and we ask for his. Close on the faces of the crew - KILLICK, HIGGINS, NAGEL, CALAMY, BLAKENEY and finally Stephen who is staring oddly Jack, as though holding him partly responsible for this latest tragedy. JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amen. CREW (mumble ashamedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amen. The men on deck remain standing, heads bowed, observing a minute's silence, as the sky begins to pale, and the whit disc of the sun appears above them. FASTER DOUDLE is the first to look up, followed by others the terrible sound has gone and a small puff of wind is stirring the mainsail.

dialogues.speaker: HOUR GLASS
dialogues.text: The sand runs out of the half-hour glass. BONDEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strike eight bells. QUARTERMASTER (to the marine sentry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn the glass and strike the bell. The glass is inverted. The bell tolls.

dialogues.speaker: SURPRISE AT SEA
dialogues.text: The ship moves through a tropical squall. Men rig a sail catch the water, others appear with barrels and tubs, anything to catch the precious rain.

dialogues.speaker: THE SURPRISE
dialogues.text: Sea birds swarming over a shoal of fish in the foreground the cry of the distant lookout carries faintly across the sea. LOOKOUT (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Land-ho!

dialogues.speaker: GANGWAY
dialogues.text: BLAKENEY runs along the gangway, past STEPHEN, en route t the quarterdeck. BLAKENEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give you joy, sir! We have raised the Galapagos! 208.     MONTAGE oF TELESCOPE VIEWS, GALAPAGOS - DAY There's a primeval quality to the landscape, a feeling of world just born. The wild creatures that inhabit the lava flows and coral beaches confirm this - the giant tortoise iguanas, sea-lions and penguins, a teeming profusion of exotic animals and plants.

dialogues.speaker: QUARTERDECK/FORECASTLE/TOPS
dialogues.text: The ship fairly bristles with telescopes.

dialogues.speaker: FORECASTLE
dialogues.text: A small group of familiar faces share a pocket telescope. HIGGINS (looking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't see any wimmun. Just lots of ducks and lizards. DOUDLE takes the telescope. DOUDLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wot? There must be wimmun. T'ain't natural.

dialogues.speaker: QUARTERDECK
dialogues.text: STEPHEN and BLAKENEY side by side. From both their faces sense their wonder at seeing these remarkable creatures f the first time. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How extraordinary. BLAKENEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, sir? STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those birds! He's looking at a group of unremarkable black seabirds waddling about on a rock, flapping short, stumpy wings. STEPHEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A species of cormorant. But apparently flightless, by all that's Holy. I believe that is unknown to science. BLAKENEY dwells briefly on the strange rock-climbing bird then drifts back to the iguanas. BLAKENEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dragons don't seem to bother 'em. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are a type of iguana I should think, and therefore vegetarian. His telescope remains focussed on the cormorants. BLAKENE wholly absorbed in the iguanas. BLAKENEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you catch one? STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Most certainly. And if we can, some eggs. BLAKENEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean the great lizards. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Recognizing how superficially dull the birds are to BLAKENEY's untutored eye, by contrast with giant lizards. STEPHEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should think a pair of them. Then you can present one of their offspring to the king. BONDEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! There's one going for a swim. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Iguanas are land animals. BONDEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not these ones. The prehistoric-looking creatures, as if suddenly awakene begin diving into the water. STEPHEN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By Jove Bonden you are right! Two new species in as many minutes. He breaks off, suddenly aware of a shouted exchange betwe the lookout and the quarterdeck. STEPHEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is all that confounded bellowing? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All hands about ship! BLAKENEY dashes off and STEPHEN is elbowed out of the way hands rushing to get at the sails. NEHEMIAH SLADE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By your leave sir, by your leave. HOLLAR (distant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helms a'lee - off tacks and sheets - mainsail haul! As the ship turns a distant whaleboat appears with six me aboard, pulling out from one of the neighboring islands.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE LEE OF THE SHIP'S HULL, (TIME-LAPSE)
dialogues.text: The whaleboat has come alongside. Men swarm down the boarding nets and the whalers are help aboard, hoarse and exhausted from rowing and shouting. HOGG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God bless you. Thank you, shipmates.

dialogues.speaker: QUARTERDECK
dialogues.text: HOGG, the senior whaler, sits with his mates, relating hi story to JACK and the officers. HOGG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We was coming back for fresh lines, hid in that inlet, yonder. Black-three master. Bit beamy and raised in the stern. Meaningful looks among Jack and his men. Its definitely t Acheron he's describing [   ] Hogg meanwhile takes a pint mug of water, gulps it down, passes it back to BLAKENEY for a refill. HOGG (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundred thousand pound of good whale oil they stole. Then the bastards... ALLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cuffs him) No swearing on the quarterdeck. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waves ALLEN away) Go on. HOGG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Then they burnt our bloody ship and headed off, bunch of fugging pirates. Looking pointedly at Allen [      ] JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And her course? HOGG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe a point south of west. Following the rest of the whaling fleet. JACK (rising)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mowett, these men to be entered on the ship's books. Mr. Allen, lay a course west sou'west. As ALLEN hurries away shouting orders - PULLINGS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we not take on fresh supplies, Sir? Those tortoises... JACK (overlapping, impatient)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's not a moment to lose, Mr. Pullings. He leaves the quarterdeck and goes below, STEPHEN followi

dialogues.speaker: IN THE GREAT CABIN
dialogues.text: JACK has taken his jacket off and is already unfurling hi charts. STEPHEN hurries in. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you forgotten your promise? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not looking up) Subject to the requirements of the service, Stephen. I could not in all conscience delay for the sake of an iguano or a... giant peccary - interesting no doubt, but of no immediate application. STEPHEN (overlap)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you dismiss, out of hand, the bounty of nature? Knowledge that... that will help to progress... JACK (overlap)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see nothing on shore that will progress our mission. STEPHEN (overlap)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how can we possibly know what lies [ ] on these islands, perhaps some knowledge that may save life, that... JACK (overlap)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will tell you how to save lives Stephen. Inform me how to guide this ship, undetected, under the nose of a 40 gun frigate. That is the job in hand sir. STEPHEN swallows his indignation and tries for a compromi STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well perhaps there's an opportunity to serve both our objectives. As I understand it you mean to go round the end of this long island, then start your voyage. I could walk across it, be on the other side long before... JACK shakes his head. STEPHEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would walk briskly, pausing only for important measurements and almost certainly making valuable discoveries... JACK (interrupts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If wind and tide had been against us I should have said yes. They are not and I am obliged to say no. (with finality) No. STEPHEN is livid. Betrayed. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. So after all this time in your service I must simply be content to form part of this belligerent expedition, hurry past inestimable wonders, bent solely on destruction... JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you forget yourself, sir. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Jack, You have forgotten your self. You once believed in the rights of each individual man no matter how useless or lowly. But it seems to me now that the long exercise of power has brought you to the point where even a solemn promise... JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The promise was conditional. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a promise to a friend of ten years standing who has stood by you and supported you.... JACK (overlapping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I command a King's ship, not a private yacht... STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...across half the worlds oceans often at risk to his own life JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and we have no time for your damned hobbies, sir! "Hobbies". So that is JACK's honest view of STEPHEN's lifetime of work in science. He bows slightly, then leave

dialogues.speaker: QUARTERDECK
dialogues.text: STEPHEN stands alone at the taffrail watching as the isla recede in the distance. News of the violent argument has spread and there is many sympathetic glance, which further humiliates STEPHEN. BLAKENEY approaches him carrying something carefully in t palm of his hand. BLAKENEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I found a curious beetle walking on the deck. He opens his hand - close, on a very plain little brown beetle. BLAKENEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's a Galapagos Beetle, sir. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure of it. BLAKENEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you to have walked all day on the island, you might never have come across it. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is more than likely, sure. BLAKENEY passes it to STEPHEN. BLAKENEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can have it. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mr. Blakeney. BLAKENEY hovers for a moment, unsure of further conversat then retreats.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE GREAT CABIN
dialogues.text: JACK sits alone at the table. KILLICK enters with toasted cheese for two. KILLICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No music? That's a shame He sets down the toasted cheese. KILLICK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just leave the one plate then, if himself won't be joining. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Killick. Just the one. JACK cuts himself a portion, scowling at STEPHEN's cello which seems to watch him reproachfully as he eats.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN'S CABIN
dialogues.text: STEPHEN takes a dropper, carefully measures twenty drops laudanum to a glass of water, and drinks.

dialogues.speaker: LOOKOUT
dialogues.text: The lookout leaning out from the cross-trees. DOUDLE (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On deck there. Object fine on the starboard bow.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHIP LYING STATIONARY
dialogues.text: A barrel is being lifted aboard from the skiff and passed the side of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WAIST OF THE SHIP
dialogues.text: JACK comes down, accompanied by ALLEN, the acknowledged expert in these matters. Others gather round, including HOGG the whaler, inspectin the stencilled markings. ALLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martha's vineyard. HOGG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, this here's from Boston. I was married there once. ALLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any road, it's a Yankee barrel. HOGG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What they call a Bedford Hog in New England. MOWETT (to JACK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Acheron touched at Boston. HOGG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's not been in the water more than a week. ALLEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One can't say with any accuracy but... HOGG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you can. There's no sea chummer on it, and the dowels is sound.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE QUARTERDECK
dialogues.text: JACK returns to his post. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Continue due west, Mr. Bonden. TOM PULLINGS watches him. There has been a change amongst officers and crew toward JACK. His relentless driving aft the Acheron has reached the point of obsession, an obsess not shared by his exhausted men. He is a lonely, haunted figure as he now steps up on the gunwale, one hand on the ratlines, scanning the empty sea sensing his enemy is out there, just beyond the curve of earth.

dialogues.speaker: LADDER, (TIME LAPSE)
dialogues.text: A wild wind humming through the rigging as STEPHEN goes topside.

dialogues.speaker: FORECASTLE
dialogues.text: He finds various hands making the boats secure. PLAICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen the bird, doctor? STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have not - no bird these many days. What kind of a bird? PLAICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sort of albatross I believe, or perhaps a prodigious great mew. He has been following the ship since... there he is, crossing our wake!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GANGWAY
dialogues.text: STEPHEN runs along the gangway to get a clearer view, checking himself when he sees JACK on the quarterdeck. Their eyes meet. The quarterdeck is JACK's domain now, an STEPHEN avoids it. Then, behind JACK, the great bird suddenly appears. It's huge, with at least a fourteen foot wing-span, and flying very close to the ship, drifting and soaring on th gusting wind, appearing and disappearing between the sail STEPHEN is mesmerized by it. He lets go of the rail, lean forward to get a better view. At the same time across from STEPHEN on the opposite gang HOWARD and two or three marines open fire on the bird. Th bird drops low, flying right by STEPHEN. Again a crackle of gunfire, but the bird is apparently uninjured, and it banks away, skimming the surface of the water. STEPHEN sags to the deck. A shout. People running. Blood spreading across the white of his shirt. HOWARD there by side. HOWARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, man! I'm so sorry. The bird dropped low. I didn't see you there! JACK is there, shouting - JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calamy! Get Higgins! (then turning to BONDEN) Padeen, Davies, carry the Doctor below. STEPHEN gets slowly up, hands reaching to help him, HOWAR the background distraught, explaining to anyone who'll li what happened. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, I am quite capable of walking. He tries to stand, crumples. 225.        STEPHEN's CABIN - DAY HIGGINS presses clumsily around the wound as STEPHEN lies the bed, his abdomen rigid, his breathing laboured. JACK watches from the door. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will just make it worse... by prodding, Mr. Higgins, it cannot be got at... except by opening me up. A violent pitching of the ship makes it obvious how impossible this will be under sail. As STEPHEN lapses into unconsciousness, HIGGINS looking alarmed, approaches JACK. HIGGINS (a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bullet took a piece of shirt in with it. Unless it is removed it will suppurate and fester. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you equal to the task? HIGGINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll need to read up on the Doctor's books, like. Study some pictures he has, get my bearings. Be better on land, but I'll manage somehow. JACK looks away from the alcoholic HIGGINS back to STEPHE

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE CABIN
dialogues.text: JACK passes an anxious crowd of the ship's company: BLAKE JOE PLAICE, KILLICK and HOWARD. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You men get about your business. There are dark looks in JACK's direction as he retreats t his cabin.

dialogues.speaker: THE GREAT CABIN
dialogues.text: JACK throws a chart on the table. With his protractor he marches out great strides west int the Pacific from the Galapagos Islands and marks the ship position - they are maybe a hundred miles from the Galapa ahead, open sea until the Marquesas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lying on his bed, in some pain, STEPHEN hears thudding fe shouted orders. In his weakened state, the sounds tend to merge. His pitching cabin keeps swimming out of focus. There's a knock on the door and JEMMY DUCKS appears with mug of soup and some biscuit. JEMMY DUCKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...sail on the horizon, sir. Hull down, running west. It may be a couple of days before we can catch her. STEPHEN nods, all he wants is quiet. JEMMY DUCKS retreats, as STEPHEN swigs from a little bott of laudanum, which for a moment brings peace, effectively blocking out the noise from above. A smile to PADEEN, like a farewell, and he closes his eye

dialogues.speaker: FORECASTLE
dialogues.text: JACK, telescope to his eye, studies the distant ship as PULLINGS jumps down from the ratlines to the deck. PULLINGS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It might be the Acheron. If we put on more sail we'd come up with her before nightfall. JACK lowers the telescope, turns his back on PULLINGS, strangely abstracted. PULLINGS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his back) Do you wish me to set the topgallants? (no reply) Sir? A long silence. Then JACK walks away. PULLINGS stares perplexed from JACK's retreating figure t the distant chase.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR STEPHEN'S CABIN
dialogues.text: Early morning light on the interior of the cabin. PADEEN asleep, holding a Bible, in the doctor's chair. STEPHEN himself lies motionless with his eyes closed and mouth open, no colour in his face. The sea is relatively calm. From outside the sound of the bosun's orders, over rattling blocks and pulleys. HOLLAR (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Clap on now! Every rope an end... Jolly-boat away... Slowly, Jenks! You grass-combing lubber! MOWETT comes in, sees STEPHEN, and takes him for dead. MOWETT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts outside) Davies! Slade! Two big men come in behind him. PADEEN wakes, confused an pushes them away, moving protectively to the doctor's sid The commotion disturbs STEPHEN. His eyes open. Like a dea man just come back to life. MOWETT (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor. You're still with us. Can we move you onto a stretcher? STEPHEN swallows uncomfortably and tries to make sense of things.

dialogues.speaker: A GALAPAGOS ISLAND
dialogues.text: A giant iguana watches as a small procession trudges up t stony beach. At its head, STEPHEN is carried in a litter up to where a tent has been set up above the high-water mark. His P.O.V. as JACK appears in the blue sky above him. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me this wasn't on my account? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dead pan) No. It was because of Higgins. (beat) Can't have him poking around in your belly without a solid platform to work on. He ducks as they enter -

dialogues.speaker: THE HOSPITAL TENT
dialogues.text: In the creamy light, they lay STEPHEN down on a recently- constructed wooden operating table. HIGGINS squats on the ground, rummaging through various l sharp surgical instruments which he has emptied onto a pi of Hessian. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All set, Higgins? STEPHEN grabs JACK's sleeve. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not Higgins. I do this with my own hand. Jack frowns, unsure what he means by this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PADEEN stands, arms crossed at the closed tent-flap, keep at bay a crowd of well-wishers, and the merely curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEPHEN sits pale and sweaty, propped up on a series of chests, his back against a coil of rope. In front of him, suspended by pulleys, LAMB and NAGEL have set up a large gilt-framed mirror. Beside him, on a white tablecloth, some small scissors an scalpels. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Jack) [ ] You are sure you have a head and a stomach for this kind of thing? JACK (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dear Doctor, I have seen blood and wounds since I was a little boy. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then hold my belly, pressing firmly when I give the word. STEPHEN begins first with the knife, then the probe - the grind of metal on living bone. STEPHEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will have to raise the rib, Higgins. Take a good grip with the square retractor. Up. Harder, harder. (to himself) Snip the cartilage. The metallic clash of instruments, perpetual swabbing. STEPHEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Jack, a steady downward pressure. Good. Keep it so. Give me the davier. Swab, Higgins. Press, Jack, press. JACK closes his eyes. STEPHEN draws in his breath, arches back, and it's done. STEPHEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There she is. He pulls out the bullet, and with it, a fragment of his shirt. STEPHEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that all of it? The bloody piece of shirt is handed to HIGGINS who matche to the hole in STEPHEN's old shirt. HIGGINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, she'll patch up nicely, sir. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy away, Jack. Handsomely with the retractor. Higgins, look to the Captain, while I swab. HIGGINS helps JACK into a chair, pressing his head down between his knees. After a moment, and a few deep breaths JACK looks up. STEPHEN smiles at him. A hint of surly triumph.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN'S TENT
dialogues.text: Through a gap in the door of his tent STEPHEN can see the distant ship at anchor. Repairs are underway, guns being unloaded, stores and fresh water being ferried aboard. BLAKENEY comes in, followed by PADEEN with a some numbere boxes hung round his neck. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My goodness, what is this? BLAKENEY starts rolling up the sides of the tent as PADEE unloads his boxes, each with a beetle and a piece of vegetation in it. BLAKENEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well sir, Padeen and I have been doing some collecting for you. The beetles each come with a specimen of plant they were found on. Ooops. Catch him, Padeen! There he goes. He finishes rolling up the tent sides to reveal a collect of cages, with native wildfowl in them, being fed by the poulterer, JEMMY DUCKS. BLAKENEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The birds were snared by Jemmy Ducks. Captain says we can keep them in the chicken coop. Then, producing a notebook - BLAKENEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I made a few notes if you want to see them. STEPHEN flips the pages: No 22. Large square black beetle with pincers. Found unde rock. Eats earthworms. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Pon my word you have the makings of a true naturalist. BLAKENEY is flattered but unsure. BLAKENEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well sir, perhaps I could combine them, and be a kind of Fighting-Naturalist, like yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen smiles at this description as he levers himself i a sitting position. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we take a tour of your aviary? BLAKENEY looks doubtfully at the doctor's bandaged abdome BLAKENEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should you really be up? STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Padeen! PADEEN puts the escaped beetle in his mouth for safe keep and offers STEPHEN a hand. STEPHEN pulls himself painfull his feet and starts buttoning his shirt. STEPHEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Blakeney) How long does the Captain intend that we stay here, do you know?

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BEACH
dialogues.text: JACK is watching those of the crew not on duty play crick on the shore, with a canvas ball and stumps made of driftwood. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, a week perhaps. There is no great hurry. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But surely, we must make haste for the Marquesas? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It may not have been the Acheron that we sighted. Nor can we be sure of her destination. (looks away) No, I think we shall go home now, before peace breaks out with France, God forbid. He's making light of what has been a huge and far-reachin decision. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how will it sit with the Admiralty? To have spent six months in a fruitless pursuit and then come home empty-handed? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Empty-handed"? Not a bit of it. What about these plants and animals which Blakeney has been collecting? The British museum will need an entire new wing for 'em. STEPHEN regards him gravely, shaking his head. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fear, Jack, you have burdened me with a debt I can never repay. He is absolutely sincere about this, to JACK's great embarrassment. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tosh. Name a shrub after me. Something prickly and hard to eradicate. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shrub? I shall name a giant tortoise: Testudo Aubreii!

dialogues.speaker: SURPRISE CAMP
dialogues.text: STEPHEN, BLAKENEY and PADEEN leave the camp on STEPHEN's first day of exploration. They are armed with nets, baske and a day's supply of food and water. STEPHEN walks slightly stooped, leaning on a walking stic

dialogues.speaker: COUNTRYSIDE
dialogues.text: A strange and wonderful landscape lies before them, with organically-shaped lava flows and alien-looking flora and fauna. Everywhere STEPHEN looks there are creatures unique to th islands. He is in his element, collecting specimens which PADEEN carefully stores in the baskets. BLAKENEY has his telescope trained on some distant humps. BLAKENEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor, would you think it very unscientific of me to ride on the back of one of those tortoises. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Mr. Blakeney. I would think it an experiment of absolutely vital importance. But afterwards, I do desire to find that flightless cormorant, assuming that is what it is, and that I still have strength enough to catch it.

dialogues.speaker: A VALLEY
dialogues.text: BLAKENEY gets astride a giant tortoise and burns his bott on its scorching hot shell.

dialogues.speaker: LAVA BEDS
dialogues.text: STEPHEN with his telescope taking notes on bird-life.

dialogues.speaker: LOW SCRUB
dialogues.text: The huge, strangely balletic figure of PADEEN chasing aft butterfly in evening light.

dialogues.speaker: A HEADLAND
dialogues.text: Wide to see another aspect of the countryside - a hint of distant sea, a rocky headland rising from the plain. The group is widely scattered. STEPHEN at the base of the headland, BLAKENEY half a mile further inland. PADEEN com up slowly behind, laden with the fruits of their expediti

dialogues.speaker: BASE OF THE HEADLAND
dialogues.text: STEPHEN rests a moment. Some stones rattle down from the hillside. He looks up to see a flash of black feathers ne the crest - the cormorant. On his shirt a red smudge has appeared. His wound has beg to bleed again. Ignoring this, Stephen pushes on after his quarry.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROCKY SLOPE
dialogues.text: Near the top, STEPHEN pauses to catch his breath and glan above him. Again the bird, moving higher, as if leading him on. STEPHEN gets down on all fours, crawling cautiously to th crest just above him.

dialogues.speaker: TOP OF THE HEADLAND
dialogues.text: A clearing. There is movement in the bushes. STEPHEN slowly rises, climbs the few paces to the hilltop enters a clearing. He searches amongst the bushes. Nothing. He turns and looks back down the hillside to see BLAKENEY PADEEN far below, then sits to get his breath back again. STEPHEN'S P.O.V: on the ground between his feet, a beetle picks it up. Close, on his hand. It is the same type of beetle BLAKENE gave him aboard the Surprise. Smiling at the coincidence STEPHEN raises the tiny creatu to eye level. His P.O.V.: the beetle, the creature in sharp focus, behi it the sea, and on the sea, a black shape. The focus shifts to the background - a ship at anchor in bay. The beetle flies away as STEPHEN stares out at the ship. the Acheron, and they are weighing anchor.

dialogues.speaker: COUNTRYSIDE
dialogues.text: BLAKENEY urging STEPHEN to hurry as they make their way through the darkening landscape. All kinds of creatures a appearing around them, and every few yards STEPHEN pauses examine something. BLAKENEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, you must hurry! STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment! You're a worse tyrant than any ship's captain. He's breathing hard, exhausted. BLAKENEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must carry him, Padeen! PADEEN looks at the collection of baskets he carries. BLAKENEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave them! We must get back to the ship. STEPHEN raises his hand in protest, but BLAKENEY is alrea divesting PADEEN of his load.

dialogues.speaker: COUNTRYSIDE
dialogues.text: PADEEN carrying STEPHEN 'piggy-back', BLAKENEY out ahead urging them on. 247a   THE DISCARDED COLLECTING BOXES A variety of small bugs and animals crawling free

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN'S CABIN
dialogues.text: STEPHEN gingerly lowers himself into his 'elbow-chair', gripping the table and BLAKENEY's good arm for support. Sighing, he begins emptying his pockets of various small items collected during the day - some leaves, rocks and insects - and places them in ordered piles around his microscope. All about them can be heard the urgent sounds of departur the anchor rattling up, shouted orders and the drumming o bare feet on the deck above. He holds up a stick in a specimen-jar, and is examining i with his magnifying glass when JACK enters. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot to ask you - did you see your bird? STEPHEN's eye grossly enlarged through the lens. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not. My greatest discovery was your phantom. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed it was, I'm sorry... STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving the magnifying glass) Not a bit of it. William and I made a unique discovery. Handing JACK the jar and magnifying glass. STEPHEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him, Mr. Blakeney. BLAKENEY (beaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a rare phasmid, Sir. JACK inspects the stick. It winks at him. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A phasmid? BLAKENEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an insect disguised as a stick. JACK stares at the creature. BLAKENEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In order to confuse a predator. JACK looks up at STEPHEN.

dialogues.speaker: BAY, GALAPAGOS
dialogues.text: The Surprise alive with crewmen on the deck and in the rigging. Shouts and commands drift across the water as sh turns and heads out from the bay. 249a         GANGWAY - SAME TIME JACK strides along the quarterdeck towards the forecastle issuing a stream of orders - JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Hollar, rouse up all the yellow paint we have. I want six men with brushes slung over the side. (moving on) Doudle! DOUDLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir. JACK hands him a piece of paper with a sketch on it. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your sail makers working on this. Sixty yards by five yards with an eyelet every seven feet. DOUDLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, Sir. He shouts to HOGG who, with a few men, is manhandling a l metal cauldron from the ballast to the gun-deck. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to HOGG) Have Nagel patch it up and light a fire in it. (shouts) Mr. Calamy! CALAMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, Sir. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once we're underway, replace some of the sails with the oldest, most patched set we have. CALAMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll be in the afterhold, Sir. I'll need some men to move all the clutter. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Spread it around the foredeck. The more mess the better.

dialogues.speaker: 249B. SIDE OF THE SHIP,. NIGHT
dialogues.text: The ship powers ahead as men swing in harnesses above the racing water, painting out the Nelson chequer.

dialogues.speaker: 249C. ON DECK. NIGHT
dialogues.text: NAGEL positions the great cauldron amidships as men come from below with old barrels and bits of rope. CALAMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haul away! On the gangway, Men under CALAMY's instructions haul on ropes, pulling up the old patched sails. The sails lead us up to

dialogues.speaker: CROSSTREES
dialogues.text: JACK, PULLINGS and the whaler HOGG scan the dark horizon. HOGG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, Sir. A mainmast toplight. JACK has to use a telescope. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got good eyes, Hogg. Shouts down to the helm - JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bonden, set a course west-south-west. (to PULLINGS) We'll drop below the horizon and come up on the other side of him, let him think he's seen us first.

dialogues.speaker: SURPRISE
dialogues.text: First light reveals the results of an overnight transformation - from a naval warship to a shambolic-look Portuguese whaler. The gunwales are painted an untidy ochre and the gun-port hidden behind broad strips of canvas. The sails are patched and ragged, the forecastle cluttere with barrels. Smoke billows from a cauldron amidships. On deck and in the rigging, there's a quarter of the norm complement of men, all of them dressed in purser's slops.

dialogues.speaker: QUARTERDECK
dialogues.text: A bemused STEPHEN looks about him as he approaches JACK. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. A wolf in sheep in sheep's clothing JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A phasmid, doctor. It was you what gave me the idea. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure a phasmid can be a predator. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? Well this one is.

dialogues.speaker: BERTH DECK
dialogues.text: HOWARD and his marines change out of their smart uniforms into the oldest most ragged clothes on board the ship, mu to the amusement of the passing sailors. CREW MEN AD LIB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very fancy. Blue to match your eyes. Is there a skirt comes with it?

dialogues.speaker: GUN-DECK
dialogues.text: Men are checking the breechings of the great guns and chipping cannonballs to make them more perfectly spherica more deadly. The armourer is at his grindstone sending out showers of sparks, a group of seamen round him relaying one another the crank, stacking newly honed cutlasses and boarding ax at their feet. Another team check and load pistols by the score.

dialogues.speaker: MIDSHIPMEN'S QUARTERS
dialogues.text: Alone, BLAKENEY awkwardly draws his dirk, left-handed fro its scabbard. It glints momentarily in the lamp-light. CALAMY enters, face aglow, abruptly trying to cover his j when he sees BLAKENEY. BLAKENEY [ ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right. Permission to boast. You're to lead the boarders from the forecastle. Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. BLAKENEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll make lieutenant out of this. The others come in. BOYLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He already has. 'Acting' 3rd Lieutenant Peter Calamy. Oohs and aahs from all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'll see you at the forecastle, 'Lieutenant'. CALAMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not your station. BLAKENEY looks from CALAMY to the others, who avoid his e BLAKENEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But naturally I'll board with you? CALAMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Will. Captain's orders. BLAKENEY is devastated. Rye bursts in, in a state of high excitement. RYE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's seen us!

dialogues.speaker: QUARTERDECK
dialogues.text: JACK raises his glass, focuses on the Acheron, plainly visible in the distance, with a line of signal flags runn up her backstay. MOWETT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's asking us to heave to. Shall I give the order? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, make a show of fleeing upwind, but panicky and disorganized, like a whaler might do. Allen smiles at this unintended slight JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No offence, Mr. Hogg.

dialogues.speaker: THE SHIPS
dialogues.text: A show of chaos on deck as the Surprise veers upwind, awa from the Acheron. As she presents her stern we see her ne name: Malacca.

dialogues.speaker: QUARTERDECK OF THE SURPRISE
dialogues.text: Through his telescope, JACK looks back at the Acheron in pursuit, a dark figure on her foredeck. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mowett) Run up Portuguese colours. (then down to the gun-deck) Load, Mr. Pullings. Triple shot 'em. BLAKENEY comes onto the quarterdeck and salutes, looking flushed and angry. BLAKENEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I speak with you, Sir. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No saluting, Mr. Blakeney, we're whalers here. BLAKENEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Calamy says I am not in the boarding party, I wanted to say - JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupts) I know what you want to say and my answer is no. I promised your mother I would return you in one piece and I have already failed her on that score. You will command a gun and then retire to defend the quarterdeck here with Dr. Maturin. BLAKENEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But sir - JACK (cutting in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to your station, Mr. Blakeney. BLAKENEY begins to salute, doesn't, and retires, tears burning his eyes. A moment later there's a flash of orange astern as the Acheron opens up with her bow-chasers. An 18 pound shot screams past the side of the Surprise to land with a colu of spray just off their bows. JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good shooting. Remind me to press her bow gunner, Mr. Pullings. The second ball takes down some rigging. JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start the water and throw some barrels overboard. He goes below.

dialogues.speaker: WAIST
dialogues.text: Barrels go overboard and pumps spout streams of water ove the side as JACK runs down to

dialogues.speaker: THE GUN-DECK
dialogues.text: The great majority of men are gathered here, more than a hundred of them crammed together with their muskets and sabres, listening to the odd thump from topsides as anoth ball from the Acheron hits home. CALAMY and his gang of young tykes are squashed in there somewhere, BOYLE, WILLIAMS, ADDISON and the rest, eyes shining with nervousness and wild anticipation, as JACK addresses his men, who shout encouragement, ad lib, in ev pause. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (plus the men ad lib) We're a long way from home. (Right you are, Captain!) A long way from anywhere, (Too true!) But if Britain rules the waves she rules these waves too. (Right she does!) And the blow we shall deal for his Majesty here will be felt just as keenly (I'll say it will) aye - and cheered just as loudly ('specially by the wimmin!) - as any dealt at Trafalgar or Cape St. Vincent. The camera moves over the upturned faces, PLAICE, NAGEL, DOUDLE, KILLICK, the midshipmen, the powder-monkeys, the whole fellowship of the ship. And finally STEPHEN watchin JACK doing what he does best: transmitting his own fearlessness into other men - the total warrior, the consummate leader. JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't say it will be easy. She's twice the men we have and they'll sell their lives dearly. But every man here is worth three of Boney's privateers, and I know there's not a faint heart among you. CALAMY pipes up - CALAMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three cheers for the Captain. MEN (deafening)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huzzah huzzah huzzah! On CALAMY, cheering like a kid at a football match as...

dialogues.speaker: QUARTERDECK
dialogues.text: Another well-placed shot from the Acheron smashes through rigging, sending down a shower of rope and cordage. JACK is back at his station by the wheel, the Acheron lit more than a half a mile astern, the figure of the captain his black coat clearly visible. JACK studies the looming black vessel, then turns and cro to BONDEN at the helm. BONDEN nods, lifting his hands fro the wheel as JACK grips the curved timber decisively, tak the strain. He feels the pulse of the ship through his fingers, looks to the sails then back to the Acheron. STEPHEN appears be him, casually smoking a cigar. He offers one to Jack, who declines [   ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another shot pierces the mizzen foresail above them, but neither man flinches. KILLICK appears with two cups of coffee, and in his belt a brace of pistols. KILLICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took the liberty, Doctor. STEPHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [    ] Thank you, Killick. JACK steers one-handed as he sips his coffee. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mowett? [  ] A poem might be in order. Another shot through the sails. MOWETT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A poem, Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment's reflection) 'Oh were it mine with sacred Maro's art, To wake to sympathy the feeling heart, A ball goes howling past the ship, MOWETT winces. MOWETT (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then might I, with unrivalled strains, deplore, Th'impervious horrors of a leeward shore.' JACK smiles, nods. MOWETT (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Transfixed with terror at th'approaching doom...' JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What! MOWETT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (apologetic) ...they were only people of the merchant service, of-course, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's now less than five hundred yards from their stern, gaining.

dialogues.speaker: QUARTERDECK
dialogues.text: JACK turns back to MOWETT. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have her Mr. Mowett. Strike the Portuguese colours and run up the Jack... Mr. Pullings. Canvas off the gun-ports, and run 'em out. Mr. Howard? Marines away aloft. The British Jack rises to the masthead replacing the Portuguese colours, as PULLINGS descends to the gun-deck.

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S SIDE -
dialogues.text: The black muzzles appear with a low rumbling sound, as

dialogues.speaker: QUARTERDECK
dialogues.text: JACK, with a wink to MOWETT, yells at the top of his voic JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helm's a lee! ....and spins the wheel hard to starboard.

dialogues.speaker: THE SURPRISE
dialogues.text: Wide, to see her swinging broadside on, across the path o the oncoming Acheron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confused shouts from the enemy's deck, chaos on her forecastle, somewhere a drum beating.

dialogues.speaker: THE SURPRISE QUARTERDECK
dialogues.text: JACK hands the wheel to BONDEN. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run us down her larboard side then cut across her wake! (shouts down to the gun deck) Hold fire Mr Pullings! Hold till we're broadside on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wide, to see the Surprise turning downwind, back towards Acheron, so they will pass broadside to broadside [   ] n more than thirty yards apart.

dialogues.speaker: QUARTERDECK/ GUN-DECK, SURPRISE
dialogues.text: Through a furious exchange of musket fire JACK runs down ladder to the gun-deck- JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire as she bears! Every gun to concentrate on her mainmast! Through the gunports the Acheron's great hull becomes visible. Some of the Acheron's guns have run out, but the crews are unprepared and disorganized. PULLINGS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the uproll! Fire for the mainmast as you sight her! As the Surprise rolls and the upper deck of the Acheron becomes visible.

dialogues.speaker: THE SURPRISE GUNS
dialogues.text: Barking, leaping back one by one, great tongues of flame spitting from their barrels, dense clouds of smoke rising

dialogues.speaker: VIEW OF THE ACHERON
dialogues.text: With an almighty splitting sound their mainmast falls, dragging yards and rigging with it, the whole mass fallin over their side, obscuring many of their gun-ports.

dialogues.speaker: GUNDECK/QUARTERDECK, SURPRISE -
dialogues.text: Cheers from the crew. Jack yelling up the companionway JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Mr Bonden! Hard a'starboard!

dialogues.speaker: THE SURPRISE AND THE ACHERON
dialogues.text: The Acheron wallows, bought to a standstill by the enormo dragging weight of their mainmast. BONDEN wheels the ship across the enemy's wake, past the exposed, vulnerable stern.

dialogues.speaker: 277A. GUNDECK, SURPRISE
dialogues.text: JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire at will!

dialogues.speaker: GUN-DECK, SURPRISE
dialogues.text: In random sequence the Surprise's gunners pound it into t Acheron's stern. Casement windows vanish in a cloud of wo and glass, exposing the Acheron's terrified gun-crews, no open to devastating fire as the Surprise glides past.

dialogues.speaker: QUARTERDECK
dialogues.text: JACK climbs up on the gunwales, shouting to BONDEN - JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lay me alongside!

dialogues.speaker: THE SURPRISE AND THE ACHERON
dialogues.text: The bow of the Surprise lurches into the Acheron mid-ship spars interlocking, the Surprise guns firing into her at point-blank range. The crew throw grappling hooks.

dialogues.speaker: 281.. QUARTERDECK
dialogues.text: JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boarders away! And he leaps to the enemy deck, a great tide of men follo after him.

dialogues.speaker: FORECASTLE
dialogues.text: CALAMY leads his own children's crusade from the bows and forecastle: youthful but terrifying, screaming and swingi their blades.

dialogues.speaker: QUARTERDECK
dialogues.text: An agonized BLAKENEY watches from where he stands beside STEPHEN. JOE PLAICE is close by with some of the older me ready to ferry the wounded below.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ACHERON
dialogues.text: As the Surprises pour onto the quarterdeck they face withering fire from the enemy. A dozen men go down, some them fatally wounded. Among them are DOUDLE, BOYLE, ALLEN HORNER in quick succession. The attack momentarily falters, and the Acherons surge ba at them. JACK rallies his men and they charge again - the marine, TROLLOPE, and NAGEL are blown backwards by grapeshot. LAMB, enraged, surges past NAGEL's body, swinging his axe devastating effect, with HOLLAR by his side and JEMMY DUC protecting their rear, a pistol in each hand, firing from hip. JACK keeps pushing onwards, the centre of the milling, swirling, hacking crowd, stabbing and pistolling each oth with barely room to fall. The Acherons are gradually forced back across their quarterdeck and down into the waist of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: WAIST OF THE ACHERON
dialogues.text: JACK crosses swords with a man in front of him, as an ene pikeman drives his blade into his left arm, tearing throu the sleeve. BONDEN fires a pistol by his ear, deafening J and killing the pikeman. To either side, privateers are trying to reach them, shouting, swearing in English, French and Spanish. Bullets and missiles rain down from above, killing friend foe alike. KILLICK is in the thick of it, a pistol in either hand, a from his lips a high-pitched blood-curdling scream. AWKWARD DAVIES is foaming at the mouth as he swings a mea cleaver right and left.

dialogues.speaker: QUARTERDECK, ACHERON
dialogues.text: A commander of the privateers notes the poorly defended Surprise, and leads a counter-attack over onto her quarterdeck. CALAMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look to our quarter-deck!

dialogues.speaker: QUARTERDECK, SURPRISE
dialogues.text: BLAKENEY, dirk in hand, turns to face them, as does HOWAR and his men, but they are gravely outnumbered.

dialogues.speaker: FORECASTLE, ACHERON
dialogues.text: CALAMY sees the danger and leads his gang back onto the Surprise, calling for others to follow. Calamy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way! Follow me!

dialogues.speaker: QUARTERDECK, SURPRISE
dialogues.text: STEPHEN, PADEEN and JOE PLAICE appear from below. STEPHEN picks up a pistol and with deadly accuracy shoots a priva lunging at CAPTAIN HOWARD. The man drops, a neat hole in forehead. A moment's astonishment from HOWARD at the Doct surprising skill. CALAMY fights his way to BLAKENEY who is down on his knee stabbing at the legs of the attackers.

dialogues.speaker: WAIST, ACHERON
dialogues.text: JACK, BONDEN and DAVIES are driving a wedge toward the st the defenders falling back in disarray.

dialogues.speaker: QUARTERDECK OF THE ACHERON
dialogues.text: PULLINGS and MOWETT fight side-by-side. A swivel-gun mounted on the taff-rail is swung to face th The gunner is about to fire when a perfectly-aimed musket ball hits him, again fired by STEPHEN.

dialogues.speaker: QUARTERDECK, SURPRISE/ACHERON
dialogues.text: CALAMY, BLAKENEY and their group force the counter-attack back onto the deck of the Acheron. The two boys fight as team as they move toward the stern.

dialogues.speaker: SIDE OF THE ACHERON
dialogues.text: Some Acherons jump overboard to escape the furious attack Others are thrown, grasping at woodwork as they fall.

dialogues.speaker: QUARTERDECK OF THE ACHERON
dialogues.text: JEMMY DUCKS turns the swivel on a group of Acherons, the grapeshot blasting them up against the gunwale.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WATER
dialogues.text: Oil burns. Men drown, others struggle to stay afloat, clinging to the mass of wreckage floating by the hull.

dialogues.speaker: WAIST OF THE SHIP
dialogues.text: Cheering from the Surprises, demands to surrender in many languages, some beg for mercy, others fight on.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW DECKS
dialogues.text: JACK moves alone, down to the berth deck. He smashes the chain off a locked-door, releasing a dozen or more prison Everywhere signs of the lethal blast through the ship's stern, bodies, guns upended, shattered timbers. He makes his way through to the Great Cabin.

dialogues.speaker: GREAT CABIN, ACHERON
dialogues.text: Four privateers look up as JACK bursts in. They have been looting their own ship's valuables, two of them are too drunk to be scared. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is your captain? Ou est votre capitaine? One man leaps out through the shattered windows. A couple others raise their hands and start jabbering in French an Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: QUARTERDECK, ACHERON
dialogues.text: It's all over for the Acherons as a French officer hauls their colours. A cheer from the Surprises - a few last shots fired. CALA and BLAKENEY cheering, BLAKENEY holding aloft the capture flag. A dying Frenchman suddenly lunges at CALAMY with a sabre. BLAKENEY steps in front of him and takes the blow.
